p: Neurological and neuromuscular disorders (NNMD) are risk factors for influenza infections possibly due to difficulty clearing secretions from respiratory tract due to impaired or reduced muscle tone and lung function could lead to severe disease [ 9]. Persons with NNMD also may have an increased susceptibility to recurrent respiratory infection due to diminished ability to protect airways through cough [ 90] and a higher risk (OR, 5.6) of influenza-related neurologic complications such as seizures [ 115].
